definition: gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)

sentences.english: They built a triumphal arch to memorialize their victory.
sentences.chinese: 他们建了凯旋门来纪念胜利。

sentences.english: Thee centre of Paris, the Arch of Triumph, rays out into twelve busy streets.
sentences.chinese: 从巴黎市中心凯旋门延伸出十二条繁华的大街。

sentences.english: Located only a short walk from Champs Elysees and Arc de Triomphe.
sentences.chinese: 仅需简短步行即可到达香榭大道和凯旋门。

sentences.english: Alhambra resident Jenny Hu felt surprised and disappointed when she first saw the Alhambra Arch.
sentences.chinese: 第一次看到阿罕布拉的凯旋门时，感到和诧异。

sentences.english: More than 100 of Europes largest one in the Arc de Triomphe.
sentences.chinese: 是欧洲100多座凯旋门中最大的一座。

sentences.english: Prior to the meeting, Hu laid a wreath at the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier beneath the Arc de Triomphe.
sentences.chinese: 会见前，胡锦涛在凯旋门向无名烈士墓献花圈。

sentences.english: Twelve roads radiate from the Triumphal Arch.
sentences.chinese: 十二条大街从凯旋门向外伸展出去。

sentences.english: Located only a short walk from Champs Elysees&Arc de Triomphe.
sentences.chinese: 仅需简短步行即可到达香榭大道和凯旋门。

pinyin: Xiang1 xie4 li4 she4 Da4 jie1

definition: bell tower/campanile/clock tower/Bell Tower, historic attraction in Xian, Beijing etc
Zhonglou district of Changzhou city 常州市[Chang2 zhou1 shi4], Jiangsu
triforium (gallery of arches above side-aisle vaulting in the nave of a church)
